definition: about a year
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year

sentences.english: Enough these small servant girls learn top in about a year.
sentences.chinese: 足夠這些小丫鬟們學上一年半載的。

sentences.english: Completion of this bridge is expected in a year or so.
sentences.chinese: 這座橋一年半載可望竣工。

not at all surprising (idiom)
several days
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to correct an error
first signs/development (of a situation)
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
(coll.) a moment/a while
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
